adminData.name: gking
adminData.comments:
Layout.php

Changed .ft-design-credit to an ID rather than a class for consistency against the other sections
Rearranged the footer elements, namely, moved Back to Top before the other elements so it can be floated right, and wrapping the Sesame and sitemap links in a wrapper for easier floating in desktop
Incorporated my PHP-based homepage H1 swapper (see https://confluence2.internetbrands.com/display/DT/Styling+a+phrase+or+certain+words+differently+in+H1s), enabling us to target a specified phrase (like "Welcome to") and wrap it in a <span>, all without the flash of unstyled content that came with doing it via JS
Removed the .ft-left, .ft-right, and text navigation PHP from the footer area, as we rarely (if ever) use those anymore
Removed modernizr.js and the code in local.js that depended on it. It's no longer needed or used, and slows down load time
Moved jQuery and Cycle2 to the bottom of layout.php to minimize render blocking
Local.less

General cleanup: simplified expanded styles with vendor prefixes to use the prefixer.less version instead for consistency and cleanliness, nested hover states under main element styles for better readability, removed .ft-left and .ft-right styles
Removed -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased; from the <body> element, as that's frequently cited for issues with font-weight in QA
Integrated Peter's navigation system & generic.less file for a mobile/tablet experience with less header clutter--using Peter's hamburger menu reduces scrolling, eliminates a big "Tap for Menu" link, and adds some visual interest with load animations.
Separated out colors.less from local.less, so now local.less includes colors.less, prefixer.less, and generic.less at the top
Colors.less

Now isolated from local.less
Generic.less

This is a file I grabbed from Peter. It contains base styles for the navigation and other areas, pulling them out of the local.less for cleaner code
Local.js

Tidied up some formatting issues
Added "add class on scroll" code to local.js; functionality that is often requested
Removed the old H1 swapper JS (see the layout.php section above)
Removed old JS we no longer use, like the "shift" and "genie" animations (we do these via CSS now)

adminData.name: gking
adminData.comments: Added  .addClass('external').attr({_blank, rel: 'noopener no referrer'}) to block a vulnerability by using only _blank

adminData.name: gking
adminData.comments:
Max and I have refactored the "page-width" CSS in the 00-SDS-RWD-TEMPLATES/ ... [psds-buildkit, elliott, fremont, larrabee, madison, olive, union] buildkits as well as the psds-buildkit used within the site manager dashboard. 

NOTE: Avalon, columbia, pacific and ravenna are not compliant with the new CSS.

As you already are aware you will be able to select your page layout from within the Sesamehub.  While testing I noticed that after creating a page, you will need to return to the add page form to set the width as it does not show up when you create the page.  This is a "feature" that will be corrected in the next hub release.
